item.title: Elias Demetracopoulos, Journalist Who Linked Greek Junta to Nixon Campaign, Dies at 87
item.description: The enigmatic Mr. Demetracopoulos often exasperated the State Department, once sued the C.I.A. and was honored in his homeland as a champion of freedom.
item.dc:creator: SAM ROBERTS
item.media:description: Elias P. Demetracopoulos in an undated photo.

item.title: U.N. Security Council Endorses Truce Deal for Syria
item.description: “It is, potentially, a historic junction,” the United Nations mediator, Staffan de Mistura, said of the cease-fire negotiated by the United States and Russia.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:description: A wounded boy was brought into a makeshift hospital in the rebel-held city of Douma, Syria, on Friday.

item.title: News Analysis: Syria Truce Comes With Price, but Not for Assad
item.description: European and Israeli intelligence officials believe the pause in fighting may consolidate President Bashar al-Assad’s hold on power.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: DAVID E. SANGER
item.media:description: A Syrian boy in a hospital bed on Friday. He was injured in Syrian government airstrikes on the rebel-held area of Douma, east of Damascus. A cease-fire went into effect at midnight.

item.title: Shabab Militants Claim Deadly Attack on Hotel in Somalia
item.description: At least 10 people were killed and dozens were wounded in an attack on a hotel and public garden in Mogadishu. Security forces managed to stop militants from storming the building, officials said.
item.dc:creator: MOHAMMED IBRAHIM
item.media:description: A injured man after an attack at the SYL Hotel in Mogadishu, Somalia, on Friday.

item.title: Shabab Militants Claim Deadly Attack on Hotel in Somalia
item.description: At least 10 people were killed and dozens were wounded in an attack on a hotel and public garden in Mogadishu. Security forces managed to stop militants from storming the building, officials said.
item.dc:creator: MOHAMMED IBRAHIM
item.media:description: A injured man after an attack at the SYL Hotel in Mogadishu, Somalia, on Friday.

item.title: Questions Nag in Sweden 30 Years After Leader’s Assassination
item.description: The unsolved shooting of Prime Minister Olof Palme in 1986 was a watershed moment in history that continues to fascinate and haunt the country.
item.dc:creator: DAVID CROUCH
item.media:description: The site in Stockholm where Prime Minister Olof Palme of Sweden was gunned down on Feb. 28, 1986, in a photograph taken the next day.

item.title: Gianni Infantino To Lead FIFA Into New Era
item.description: Mr. Infantino defeated three other candidates in an election that many soccer officials hope will be a new beginning for the embattled soccer body.
item.dc:creator: SAM BORDEN
item.media:description: Gianni Infantino celebrated his election as president of FIFA on Friday.

item.title: Japan Lost Nearly a Million People in 5 Years, Census Says
item.description: A downward trend had been indicated for years, but a national count made it official. The population total in 2015 was lower, by almost a million, than that of the census in 2010.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN SOBLE
item.media:description: A business district in Tokyo last week. Japan’s population of 127.1 million in 2015 was down by almost a million compared with the last census in 2010.

item.title: Amid Iraqi Chaos, Moktada al-Sadr, an Old Provocateur, Returns
item.description: Mr. Sadr, a cleric whose command of the Iraqi Shiite street is unmatched, is ostensibly lending support to Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi.
item.dc:creator: TIM ARANGO
item.media:description: Supporters of Moktada al-Sadr listened to his speech at a demonstration in Tahrir Square in Baghdad on Friday.

item.title: Palestinian Fugitive Found Dead Outside Embassy in Bulgaria
item.description: Omar Zayed, 52, had been living in Bulgaria after he escaped in 1990 from custody in Israel, where he was convicted of killing a yeshiva student.
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID
item.media:description: The police patrolled near the Palestinian Embassy compound in Sofia, Bulgaria, on Friday. A Palestinian man, Omar Zayed, had been appealing to the embassy to avoid extradition to Israel on murder charges.

item.title: As Some Iranians Register Dislike at Polls, Others Do So by Staying Home
item.description: People in middle-class areas of the capital stood in long lines to vote, but in less prosperous areas, there was much less enthusiasm, and turnout seemed lower.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ERDBRINK
item.media:description: Iranians prepared their ballots before voting for for two separate bodies, Parliament and the Assembly of Experts, in Qum on Friday.

item.title: Doubts in Asia Over Whether New Sanctions Against North Korea Can Work
item.description: Analysts say a draft resolution circulating at the United Nations has too many loopholes for it to induce the isolated nation to denuclearize.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN and EDWARD WONG
item.media:description: North Korean soldiers patrolling on the border with China on Feb. 10.

item.title: Man Suspected of Having I.R.A. Ties Gets 18-Month Term for Tax Evasion
item.description: Thomas Murphy, believed to be an ex-leader of the Irish Republican Army and an ally of the Sinn Fein president, was sentenced by a three-judge panel.
item.dc:creator: DOUGLAS DALBY

item.title: The Saturday Profile: She Was Asked to Switch Seats. Now She’s Charging El Al With Sexism.
item.description: A lawsuit claims that an airline discriminated against Renee Rabinowitz by moving her seat after an ultra-Orthodox man said he did not want to sit next to a woman.
item.dc:creator: ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:credit: Uriel Sinai for The New York Times
item.media:description: Renee Rabinowitz at her home in Jerusalem.

item.title: Trial in Firebombing of Refugees Exposes Far-Right Grip in Germany
item.description: As Germany struggles to absorb more than one million refugees, attacks against them present an increasingly pressing challenge for the authorities.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: ALISON SMALE
item.media:description: A fire damaged a hotel that had been converted into a refugee shelter in Bautzen, Germany, on Sunday.

item.title: Palestinian to End Hunger Strike After Israel Agrees to Free Him by May
item.description: Mohammad al-Qeeq, a television journalist, is one of several prisoners who have refused food to protest their detention without known charges.
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID
item.media:description: Relatives visited Mohammad al-Qeeq, who has been on a hunger strike for over 90 days, at a hospital in Afula, Israel, in February.

item.title: Relatives of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 Victims Denounce Government’s Move
item.description: Some family members contend that the restructuring of the struggling carrier could leave it without sufficient assets to compensate them.
item.dc:creator: RICHARD C. PADDOCK
item.media:description: Bao Lanfang, right, a relative of passengers on Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, as she waited for information outside the carrier’s office in Beijing last year.

item.title: Pastor in China Who Resisted Cross Removal Gets 14 Years in Prison
item.description: The pastor, Bao Guohua, and his wife were convicted on graft and other charges amid a campaign in southeastern China to limit Christian churches’ influence.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: EDWARD WONG
item.media:description: A church member trying to prevent the removal of a cross from a church in Zhejiang Province. In the last two years, the government there has been carrying out a campaign to limit the influence of Christian churches and groups.

item.title: Musangwe Fight Club: A Vicious Venda Tradition
item.description: No gloves, no headgear, no time limits. Only when one fighter submits can the fight can come to an end. Also, no gambling. Just fighting.
item.dc:creator: BEN C. SOLOMON

item.title: Teenage Girl Rescued From ISIS Returns Home to Sweden
item.description: Marilyn Nevalainen, now 16, left for Syria last year with her boyfriend, a Muslim she had met in Sweden. She eventually reached Mosul, Iraq.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ALISSA J. RUBIN
